bond.reconcile

Class Reconciler

  • Object
    • bond.reconcile.Reconciler

  • public abstract class Reconciler
extends Object

    Class to reconcile differences between the reference set of observations and the current set of observations.

    Should be subclassed to implement different types of reconciliation logic.

      • getReconciler

        The proper Reconciler

      • reconcile

        public boolean reconcile(String testName,
                         File referenceFile,
                         List<String> currentLines,
                         String noSaveMessage)
                  throws IOException

        The main entrypoint to the class; performs reconciliation.

        If reconciliation was successful and noSaveMessage is null, the reconciled set of observations are saved to referenceFile, overriding the previous set of reference observations.

        Parameters:
        testName - The name of the current test
        referenceFile - File containing the set of reference observations; if this file does not exist, it will be treated as if it was empty.
        currentLines - A list of all of the current observations, broken into single-line strings.
        noSaveMessage - If the test failed, a String explaining the failure. Else, null.
        Returns:
        True iff the reconciliation was successful
        Throws:
        IOException - If errors are encountered while writing out reconciled observations

      • reconcileDiffs

        protected abstract Optional<List<String>> reconcileDiffs(String testName,
                                                         File referenceFile,
                                                         List<String> currentLines,
                                                         List<String> unifiedDiff,
                                                         String noSaveMessage)
                                                  throws IOException
        The primary reconciliation logic.
        Parameters:
        testName - The name of the current test.
        referenceFile - The file containing the current set of reference observations
        currentLines - A list of all of the current observations, broken into single-line strings.
        unifiedDiff - A list of all lines of the unified diff between referenceFile and currentLines
        noSaveMessage - If the test failed, a String explaining the failure. Else, null.
        Returns:
        Optional.absent() if the reconciliation failed; in this case no new observations will be saved. Else, return a list of all of the lines that should be saved as the new reference observations.
        Throws:
        IOException - If errors are encountered while writing out reconciled observations

      • getDiffString

        protected String getDiffString(String testName,
                               List<String> unifiedDiff)
        Prepare a full diff string to be printed based off of the test name and list of unified diff lines.
        Parameters:
        testName - Test name
        unifiedDiff - List of unified diff lines
        Returns:
        String to be printed to show the current diffs

      • printf

        protected void printf(String formatString,
                      Object... objs)
        Used internally to print to the console; this should be used for any printing performed within a Reconciler
        Parameters:
        formatString - Formatting string, a la PrintStream's printf
        objs - Objects to be formatted

      • getUserInput

        protected String getUserInput(String prompt,
                              List<String> options,
                              List<String> singleCharOptions)
        Retrieve user input. Attempts to use the console; if one cannot be found, instead creates a dialog box to request input.
        Parameters:
        prompt - The prompt to be displayed to the user.
        options - List of options to be presented to the user. Must be at least one. The last option in the list will be the default.
        singleCharOptions - The single-character shortcut to each one of the options, which must appear somewhere in the option itself.
        Returns:
        The option which was selected by the user.

      • getUserInput

        protected String getUserInput(String prompt,
                              List<String> options,
                              List<String> singleCharOptions,
                              String extraPromptForDialog)
        Retrieve user input. Attempts to use the console; if one cannot be found, instead creates a dialog box to request input.
        Parameters:
        prompt - The prompt to be displayed to the user.
        options - List of options to be presented to the user. Must be at least one. The last option in the list will be the default.
        singleCharOptions - The single-character shortcut to each one of the options, which must appear somewhere in the option itself.
        extraPromptForDialog - If a dialog box is used instead of a console to request user input, display this string before prompt
        Returns:
        The option which was selected by the user.

      • getUserInputFromDialog

        protected String getUserInputFromDialog(String prompt,
                                        List<String> options)
        Create a dialog to retrieve user input.
        Parameters:
        prompt - Text to display
        options - Options to display as buttons, with the last option being the default.
        Returns:
        The selected option
